chunk_metadata.created_by: Enhanced Markdown Chunker with Comprehensive Context

works.Name: Oratorium nach Bildern der Bibel
works.Notes: Third of three church works composed in 1831; modal harmonies create an "archaic" atmosphere; also known as "Musik für die Toten der Cholera-Epidemie 1831"
works.Long Description: This oratorio is the third of three church works composed in 1831; its scoring is more abundant than that of the cantatas composed prior to it. Once again Fanny looks back in musical history, this time to the pre-Baroque era, and adds a new dimension to her own compositional language by doing so. At times modal harmonies create an "archaic" atmosphere for the biblical texts.
works.Short Description: Large-scale oratorio with pre-Baroque influences and modal harmonies

works.Name: Faust II
works.Notes: Kantate nach Johann Wolfgang von Goethe; orchestrated by Reinhard Fehling; text from Part II, Act I (lines 4613-4678) depicting Ariel's song and chorus of elf spirits
works.Long Description: The manuscript is dated 23 March 1843. The text is based on the opening stanzas (4613-4678) of Part II, Act I and depicts the song of Ariel and the chorus of elf spirits. Fanny Hensel wrote: "...this score is one of the many acts of mine that will forever remain undone."
works.Short Description: Cantata after Goethe's Faust II, orchestrated by Reinhard Fehling

works.Name: Festspiel "Die Hochzeit kommt"
works.Notes: Composed for her parents' silver wedding anniversary; allegorical representation of three weddings (first, silver, golden); humorous and celebratory
works.Long Description: Hensel composed this festive play, her first extended three-part scenic work with orchestra, for her parents' silver wedding anniversary. It is an allegorical representation of three weddings: the first, the silver, and the golden. A light-hearted, celebratory piece with humorous elements and lyrical melodies culminating in a joyous choral section of praise.
works.Short Description: Festive play for parents' silver wedding anniversary

works.Name: Zum Fest der heiligen Cäcilia
works.Notes: Two versions: strings only vs. with winds; composed for St. Cecilia's Day (22 November); based on 856 Mass for St. Cecilia; doxological piece
Instrumentation: Version 2 adds: 2 flutes, 2 oboes, 2 clarinets, 2 bassoons
works.Long Description: Saint Cecilia is one of the few female saints honored as patroness of music since the late 15th century. Fanny Hensel's composition is based on the Mass for St. Cecilia from 856, celebrated on 22 November. A doxological piece - a short hymn of praise ascribing glory to God.
works.Short Description: Cantata for St. Cecilia's Day with two scoring versions

works.Name: Hero und Leander
works.Source/Collection: Von Goethe inspiriert: Lieder von Komponistinnen für Singstimme und Orchester
works.Short Description: Dramatic scene for voice and orchestra

chunk_info.processing_notes: Extracted 5 complete works by Fanny Hensel from the current chunk. All have clear titles, composer, and publication/composition years. The 'Von Goethe inspiriert' collections contain individual songs by various composers, but only Hero und Leander by Hensel is presented as a standalone work with sufficient detail.
